unnormalised: Hey guys, I was just reading up on the 2021 census - y'know, the one that got delayed a bit thanks to COVID. Turns out India's population is somewhere around 1.39 billion ppl! Imagine trying to count each and every one of us. I wonder how accurate these numbers really are, especially considering the logistical nightmare it must be to reach every corner of India.
normalised: Hey guys, I was just reading up on the two thousand twenty one census - you know, the one that got delayed a bit thanks to C-O-V-I-D. Turns out India's population is somewhere around one point three nine billion people! Imagine trying to count each and every one of us. I wonder how accurate these numbers really are, especially considering the logistical nightmare it must be to reach every corner of India.

unnormalised: Anyways, the data shows a growth rate of roughly 1.1% per annum. That's still a significant number, even if it's a slight dip from previous decades. It also mentions that the urban population accounts for around 35% of the total. Makes you think about the pressure on our cities, right? Cities like Mumbai and Delhi are already bursting at the seams.
normalised: Anyways, the data shows a growth rate of roughly one point one percent per annum. That's still a significant number, even if it's a slight dip from previous decades. It also mentions that the urban population accounts for around thirty five percent of the total. Makes you think about the pressure on our cities, right? Cities like Mumbai and Delhi are already bursting at the seams.

unnormalised: I also read something about the sex ratio being 933 females per 1000 males - I hope it improves in the next count! Its crazy to think so many factors influence these numbers; birth rates, healthcare access, migration… it's all so interconnected. It will be interesting to see what stories future Census’s tell.
normalised: I also read something about the sex ratio being nine hundred thirty three females per one thousand males - I hope it improves in the next count! Its crazy to think so many factors influence these numbers; birth rates, healthcare access, migration… it's all so interconnected. It will be interesting to see what stories future Census's tell.
